text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Neo Geo MVS is an arcade system launched in 1990 by the Japanese company SNK. It was marketed as 24-bit and could display a resolution of 320 Ã— 224 in 4096 colors of 65536. The MVS offers arcades the ability to place up to six cartridges in a single terminal, an economic consideration for operators with limited floorspace, or to save money in the long-run. Strictly Identical AES branded models were also created. Well known for its quality 2D game library and many fighting games, most originals have been ported to roms for other emulators.
